result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: copy of discovery material filed by Atty Lippert to Atty Middleton
for the 8/17/22 Preliminary Hearing filed by Court Reporter Brenda Young

3:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Maxwell N White-Ray in court.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Maxwell N White-Ray. State called witness Officer R. Messer of Fall River P.D., sworn. Direct exam. Cross exam. Witness excused. Closing argument from State. Attorney Middleton objected to bind over. Court found probable cause, bound the defendant over for further proceedings. 4:00 PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion for Preservation of Evidence filed by Attorney Middleton
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Attorney Middleton

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maxwell N White-Ray appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail w/Atty Claire Edwards. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $2,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia, no time limit waiver,
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
